meanings.definition: In a clumsy or unskilled manner
meanings.sent1: He tried to fix the broken chair ineptly, causing it to fall apart even more.
meanings.sent2: She danced ineptly at the party, stepping on toes and stumbling.
meanings.sent3: The magician ineptly attempted to pull a rabbit out of his hat but ended up with a handful of confetti.
meanings.sent4: The new driver ineptly navigated through the busy city streets, causing chaos wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The chef ineptly chopped vegetables, sending them flying in all directions.

meanings.sent1: The ineptly written essay received a low grade due to numerous spelling errors.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his ineptly crafted wooden sculptures that often fell apart.
meanings.sent3: The ineptly drawn portrait made the subject look like a cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: Her ineptly played piano piece sounded more like a series of random notes.
meanings.sent5: The ineptly designed bridge collapsed under its own weight before it was even completed.
